# AES-Obfuscator


üîê Obfuscate.py ‚Äì AES-Based PowerShell Payload Obfuscator
Introduction
Obfuscate.py is a high-grade obfuscation and payload delivery utility tailored for Ethical Hacking, Penetration Testing, and Red Teaming operations. It is engineered to circumvent modern detection mechanisms, including Next-Gen Antivirus (NGAV) and Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR) solutions, by leveraging strong encryption and dynamic code transformation techniques.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

‚ö†Ô∏è Disclaimer
This tool is intended strictly for authorized security assessments and educational purposes only. The author assumes no liability for any misuse. Unauthorized use against systems without explicit permission is a violation of applicable laws.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________


Core Functionality
The tool accepts a PowerShell payload and encrypts it using AES-256. It then generates a fully obfuscated PowerShell one-liner that automatically decrypts the payload at runtime and executes it in memory using Invoke-Expression (IEX).

Key Features
üîê AES-256 Encryption: A new, cryptographically secure random key is generated on every execution to ensure maximum entropy and detection evasion.

üé≠ Dynamic Obfuscation: Every output is unique, hindering signature-based detection.

‚öôÔ∏è Ready-to-Execute One-Liner: Generates a compact PowerShell one-liner, ideal for use in C2 channels or direct execution.

üõ°Ô∏è Offensive Security Focus: Purpose-built for adversary simulation, stealthy execution, and payload delivery in secure testing environments.

Usage
python3 obfuscate.py -p <YOUR_POWERSHELL_PAYLOAD>
Upon execution:

Your payload is encrypted with AES-256,

A decryption stub and the encrypted data are Base64-encoded and embedded,

A self-decrypting PowerShell one-liner is generated and output to the console.

_______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________

Sample Output (truncated for brevity)(This executes calc.exe):

powershell -nop -w hidden -enc
